words.definition: Deoxyribonucleic acid, the carrier of genetic information.
words.context: DNA contains the instructions an organism needs to develop, live and reproduce.

words.definition: An organelle that produces cellular energy through ATP synthesis.
words.context: Mitochondria generate most of the cell's supply of ATP, used as a source of chemical energy.

words.definition: The central and most important part of a cell, containing the genetic material.
words.context: The nucleus regulates gene expression and mediates the replication of DNA during the cell cycle.

words.definition: Process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy
words.context: Plants use photosynthesis to produce glucose from sunlight
